fields.description:
h3. Summary

LDAP server with more than 1000 groups has multiple groups with a name starting with # and is not shown in the user picker field when added to the user roles. 

The groups are visible in user management -> group section but can not be added to user roles in project 
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 8.10 or latest (replicable only on customer site)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple groups with #, & in JIRA
 # When searched in user roles in a project the groups are not shown.
 # The same group is synced and added to the group section and visible 

h3. Expected Results

Return groups #, & names
h3. Actual Results

No users are returned/some results showed 
h3. Workaround
h5. Create groups without # start and it should be good

Note - The issue is not producible in our local instance.
fields.summary: Multiple LDAP group name starting with #, & special characters not coming user picker field

h3. Issue Summary

Jira Admin wants to identify which issues were created by JIM.

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.0+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import a number of issues with JIM (for example, CSV)
# At a later time, the admin wants to find out which issues were imported via JIM or created in the UI

h3. Expected Results
The source of the Jira issue should be identifiable (UI, JIM, REST, Automation, etc.)

h3. Actual Results
There is no field data or other audit method to identify source of issue.

fields.description:
There have been a few cases where customers would report being not able to perform various operations pertaining to really long ticket.
Upon investigating, Support identified that most of these issues stem from a known MS limitation where by a single procedure can not handle more than 2100 parameters:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/stored-procedures/specify-parameters?view=sql-server-ver15
{quote}
A procedure can have a maximum of 2100 parameters; each assigned a name, data type, and direction. Optionally, parameters can be assigned default values.
{quote}

We have a couple of bugs stemming from this limitation:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65961
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63290

In plain terms, a use case would be an issue in JIRA with more than 2000 comments; Affected customers would need to trim such issues before they can delete it

It would be great to include this limitation to our 'Connecting to MS SQL' JIRA guides so that customers are aware in advance that they may run into a limitation like this:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-a-database-938846850.html
fields.summary: Update 'connecting JIRA to MS SQL' guides with current limitations

fields.description:
Currently, whenever a Jira System Administrator access the administrative panel, by using the following options to disable CAPTCHA on signup:

    * *Jira Administration Icon* > *System* > *Edit settings*

The user interface will display the field to disable CAPTCHA on login and the option to disable it on signup. However, as both options are close to one another, it can be confusing and the user interface could be improved to better reflect the difference:

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-24 at 12.40.32.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
When Jira is running on Oracle DB, irrespective of the database version, the type in dbconfig.xml and also in System Info UI, is always shown as 10g. 
This was probably introduced for entity mapping but its a little confusing when the version used is different. 
So a better way would be probably to change it to just Oracle instead of mentioning the 10g version.
fields.summary: Oracle Database Type always shows 10g

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Incremental synchronisation fails back to Full synchronisation with a SQL Exception only in Jira version 8.11.x versions in Postgres database
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.11.x version
 # Connect to AD (Tested with Microsoft AD windows with Postgres database)
 # Perform a Synchronisation (⚙️> User Management > User Directories > Synchronise)
 # Parallely check atlassian-jira.log
 # Full synchronisation works as expected
 # Hit the 'Synchronise' button right after a Full sync to force Jira perform an Incremental sync (OR wait for an auto Incremental sync)
 # Check atlassian-jira.log

h3. Expected Results

Incremental synchronisation should not fail back to Full synchronisation with a SQL Exception
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file: [^Complete Stack trace]
{noformat}
2020-08-24 15:23:52,433+0530 Caesium-2-3 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] Incremental synchronisation for directory [ 10000 ] was unexpectedly interrupted, falling back to a full synchronisation
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, group_name, lower_group_name, active, local, created_date, updated_date, description, lower_description, group_type, directory_id, external_id FROM public.cwd_group WHERE (directory_id=?) AND (local =  ? ) (ERROR: operator does not exist: numeric = boolean
  Hint: No operator matches the given name and argument types. You might need to add explicit type casts.
  Position: 212)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:408)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.WrappingOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(WrappingOfBizDelegator.java:283)

fields.description:
Hi there

We are currently looking into upgrading to Jira Data Center version. Therefor we tried to write our own Helm charts for it, so we could run it on our internal Kubernetes infrastructure.

When starting a Jira container in clustered mode, it tries to save it's node entity into the postgres database. At this point the error occurs:
{code:java}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ClusterNode][nodeState,ACTIVE][ip,test-jira-software-0.test-jira-software.jira-namespace.svc.cluster.local][cacheListenerPort,40001][nodeVersion,8.5.6][nodeId,test][nodeBuildNumber,805006][timestamp,1596797586988] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO clusternode (NODE_ID, NODE_STATE, TIMESTAMP, IP, CACHE_LISTENER_PORT, NODE_BUILD_NUMBER, NODE_VERSION) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)))
{code}
The error is happening because the value `test-jira-software-0.test-jira-software.jira-namespace.svc.cluster.local` has more than 60 characters.

Since this is a reverse lookup the entire fqdn is taken. In the case of kubernetes you end up with this long string, because that's the cluster internal fqdn to the container/pod.

There are multiple ways to solve this issue:
 * Expand the field clusternode to a higher varying value (like 200)
 * Instead of doing a reverse lookup, use the actual IP address.
 * Add a configuration field in the cluster.properties to overwrite this field.

This would be very helpful not just for kubernetes use-cases, but for everyone who uses long fqdn names.

Let me know if you need more detail on this case.
fields.summary: Expand IP field in clusternode table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL search for few words not working without adding \ in front of "(quotes) though the word is not listed in [reserved words|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/advanced-searching-939937709.html#]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a custom field (Navigate to Jira administration > issues > custom fields)with the name "Absatzmittler" of type "Text Field (single line)" and associated with all screens.
 #  change the indexing language and default language to "German" (Navigate to Jira administration > General configuration > Edit settings)
 # create 2 issues for the field "Absatzmittler" value contains DM and AM
 # try to search the issues like below using *JQL* like Absatzmittler ~ "DM" returns issues however Absatzmittler ~ "AM" is not returning any issues
 !Screenshot 2020-08-19 at 2.24.45 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-08-19 at 2.24.55 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # try to search for AM with double quotes still, we couldn't search.
 !Screenshot 2020-08-19 at 2.25.09 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # try with this JQL {{Absatzmittler ~ \"AM\"}} and finally it worked(y)
 !Screenshot 2020-08-19 at 2.26.23 PM.png|thumbnail!

(!) This is also reproducible when the indexing language is set to  "English - Moderate Stemming" and Default language set to "English (US)" & also with "English (india)"
h3. Expected Results

both *JQL queries* Absatzmittler ~ "DM",  Absatzmittler ~ "AM" should return results
h3. Actual Results

*JQL* like Absatzmittler ~ "DM" returns issues however Absatzmittler ~ "AM" is not returning any issues
h3. Workaround
 # try with the JQL like {{Absatzmittler ~ \"AM\"}}  it works
 !Screenshot 2020-08-19 at 2.26.23 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JQL search for few words not working without adding \ in front of " though the word is not listed in reserved words

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Enabling {{com.atlassian.jira.security}} (at [ *Administration* > *System* > *Logging & Profiling* ] ) might cause JIRA to stall.

Incoming thread will be fighting for {{org.apache.log4j.Logger}} lock in {{workflowPermissionCheck}}

Those logs will be written into {{atlassian-jira.log}} file in <JIRA_HOME>/logs/ folder.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to ⚙ > System > Log and profiling
 ## Click on "Configure logging level for another package."
 ## Use "com.atlassian.jira.security" as the package name, and select "DEBUG" for the "Logging Level"
 # Generate a high load of activity in Jira related to issues (create issues, edit issue, etc...)

h3. Expected Results

Jira works fine

h3. Actual Results

Jira might eventually become unresponsive, as almost all incoming http threads are *blocked waiting* to obtain the logger lock to log debugging information into the file atlassian-jira.log

h5. Thread dump details

Looking into thread dumps, we can see that the same exact pattern keeps repeating:
 - more than 140 threads are waiting for the same lock and try to write into the Jira log files:
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-167 url:/rest/gadgets/1...reated.vs.resolved url:/rest/api/2/mypermissions username:q1057533" #284713 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f626c022800 nid=0xb633 waiting for monitor entry [0x00007f6008b4e000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
	at org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton.doAppend(AppenderSkeleton.java:231)
	- waiting to lock <0x00000003c14b8448> (a org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender)
	at com.atlassian.jira.logging.JiraHomeAppender.doAppend(JiraHomeAppender.java:206)
	at org.apache.log4j.helpers.AppenderAttachableImpl.appendLoopOnAppenders(AppenderAttachableImpl.java:69)
	at org.apache.log4j.Category.callAppenders(Category.java:219)
	at org.apache.log4j.Category.forcedLog(Category.java:402)
	at org.apache.log4j.Category.log(Category.java:869)
	at org.slf4j.impl.Log4jLoggerAdapter.debug(Log4jLoggerAdapter.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.workflowPermissionCheck(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.workflowPermissionCheck(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.lambda$hasProjects$0(DefaultPermissionManager.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager$$Lambda$1334/817143143.apply(Unknown Source)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.indexOf(Iterators.java:764)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.any(Iterators.java:663)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterables.any(Iterables.java:608)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasProjects(DefaultPermissionManager.java:266)
{code}
 - while at the same time 1 thread is holding the lock, and also trying to write into the log files
{code:java}
"http-nio-8080-exec-81 url:/login.jsp" #145984 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f6260024000 nid=0x24c runnable [0x00007f600884c000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.writeBytes(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.write(FileOutputStream.java:326)
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.writeBytes(StreamEncoder.java:221)
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.implFlushBuffer(StreamEncoder.java:291)
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.implFlush(StreamEncoder.java:295)
	at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.flush(StreamEncoder.java:141)
	- locked <0x000000063ca28730> (a java.io.OutputStreamWriter)
	at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.flush(OutputStreamWriter.java:229)
	at org.apache.log4j.helpers.QuietWriter.flush(QuietWriter.java:59)
	at org.apache.log4j.WriterAppender.subAppend(WriterAppender.java:324)
	at org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender.subAppend(RollingFileAppender.java:276)
	at org.apache.log4j.WriterAppender.append(WriterAppender.java:162)
	at org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton.doAppend(AppenderSkeleton.java:251)
	- locked <0x00000003c14b8448> (a org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender)
	at com.atlassian.jira.logging.JiraHomeAppender.doAppend(JiraHomeAppender.java:206
{code}
 - logs will be flooded with this message (thousand times per second)
{code:java}
2020-08-18 14:30:36,485 http-nio-8080-exec-30 url:/rest/api/1.0/menus/find_link username:XXXXXXXX url:/login.jsp DEBUG anonymous XXXxXXXXXXxXXX - XXXXX /login.jsp [c.a.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager] CREATE_ISSUES permission denied by permission scheme
{code}

h3. Workaround

Disable the debugging package {{com.atlassian.jira.security}} (or any sub-debugging packages of it (such as {{com.atlassian.jira.security.DefaultPermissionManager}} or {{com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager}})


h3. Note

This type of issue is more likely to occur if Jira is writing log files on a slow hard disk, so one way to mitigate this issue would be to change the location of Jira's home folder (where the Jira application logs are stored) to a faster disk.
fields.summary: Enabling the debugging package com.atlassian.jira.security (or any sub-package) might cause JIRA to stall

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using proxies which make use of refresh tokens, such as Azure Application Proxy (AAP), Jira does not seem to be able to properly detect them, causing undesired behavior regarding user sessions.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve how Jira handles refresh tokens, so proxies that make use of them can work better with Jira.
fields.summary: Ensure that Jira can handle refresh tokens when using Jira over a reverse proxy

fields.description:
Provide the ability to have the ‘Add User’ button removed in Jira so that project-admins cannot just add users to their projects outside of our formal entitlements request process that involves Crowd and other internal tools.

We have been discussing internally our risk item where Jira by default has the ‘add-user’ button which in our case allows project-admins to add users to their project outside of our internal Horizon access request process.

 or review – internally here what we are doing as a ‘compensating control’, is that we are hiding the button and also have a cleanup script that removes permissions that were added directly in Jira outside of the formal request process (permissions in Jira that are not in Crowd).

Our risk team has asked a couple of questions that I need your help with answering which are the following:
 # Do you know the official RFE (request-for-enhancement) ticket for this specific ask from us regarding the Jira add-user button?
 # Can you please open an almost identical RFE ticket for Confluence for removing/disabling the ‘Edit-Permissions’ button in Confluence that provides Space-Owners a similar ability to add permissions outside of our formal Horizon access request process?
fields.summary: Provide the ability to have the ‘Add User’ button removed in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing Issues into a Project via CSV or JSON, if there is a trailing or leading white space, Jira will create a new entry for that element rather than merging with existing elements.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export Issues in a Project in CSV. 
 # Add a whitespace before or after a value. 
 # Import the Issues into Jira.  

In the particular case that spurred this Suggestion, Issues were imported that had a whitespace preceding the Version.  Jira now shows _two_ versions that have the same version number.  However, when rendering the versions on the page, the whitespace is disregarded by Java, and so the two identically-displayed versions are confusing to end users (they don't know why there are two identical versions displayed and cannot know which one to choose).  Different issues will be displayed under the two identical versions. 
h3. Expected Results

Jira will disregard the extra whitespace and merge or map the values to existing values. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira creates a separate entry for the value instead of merging the value into existing fields. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Check for trailing or leading white spaces before Issue import

fields.description:
When customers are migrating from Jira Cloud to Server, they are sometimes required to make manual changes to how 3rd-party apps behave differently between Cloud and Server.

Examples:
* Post-functions added by Suite Utilities need to be recreated
* Message custom fields (Jira Toolkit) accept wiki markup in Cloud but only HTML in Server.

We could add warnings like this to our migration documentation below to better prepare customers
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver086/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-applications-990552954.html

Beecom (Suite Utilities vendor) has a page that could be referred in our migration page as well to help.
fields.summary: Update Migration Cloud to Server doc with 3rd party apps steps

Hi recently we have set up a mirror for Bitbucket but we are finding many issues that makes it not usable. Please find the list below.
 * When we setup a mirror we would like to do all the automation also using it. Not half automation code to use mirror and half to use server. What is happening is mirror supports only few actions like clone etc. But rest api does not work on mirror. 
 ** For example in code we will be cloning a repo from mirror but when i want to deploy and download a raw yaml file for download we will have to use main server. Rather than confusing users we have to tell them to use only server for all automation
 * For mirror to work both main server url and mirror url has to be accessible to end user. For some scenarios if user only has access to mirror or only access to server then most of the mirroring features will not work

fields.description:
h4. Summary

In the New Editor, when users type Atlassian product names, they will automatically format to the desired format.
h4. Example

JIRA or jira > Jira
 BitBucket > Bitbucket
 HipChat > Hipchat
h4. Solution

Users want the ability to choose whether or not this occurs. Provide a way to disable the formatting of Atlassian products if users do not desire it.
h4. Workaround

After the text is autoformatted, ctrl+Z (Windows) or cmd+Z (macOS) will revert the change.
fields.summary: Ability to disable autocorrecting of Atlassian product names in new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error below is returned during the installation process:
{panel}
The server time zone value 'EDT' is unrecognized or represents more than one time zone. You must configure either the server or JDBC driver (via the 'serverTimezone' configuration property) to use a more specific time zone value if you want to utilize time zone support.
{panel}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install Jira using Timezone set to America/New_York, for example.
h3. Expected Results

No error during the Jira installation.
h3. Actual Results

Error below returned during the installation process:
{panel}
The server time zone value 'EDT' is unrecognized or represents more than one time zone. You must configure either the server or JDBC driver (via the 'serverTimezone' configuration property) to use a more specific time zone value if you want to utilize time zone support.
{panel}
h3. Workaround

Set timezone as UTC to bypass the timezone check and finish the setup Wizard. This is described in [this community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/The-server-time-zone-value-CEST-is-unrecognized-or-represents/qaq-p/1172019].
fields.summary: Setting up Jira returns a timezone error on SetupDatabase.jspa

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Accessing a non-ascii attachement prints incorrect data due to lack of correct encoding
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a file containing unicode characters
 # Access the issue and open the attachment in a new browser window

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is printed correctly
h3. Actual Results

The printed content is incorrect and the whole file shows as garbage data

The below warning shows when using FireFox as the browser:
{noformat}
The character encoding of the plain text document was not declared. The document will render with garbled text in some browser configurations if the document contains characters from outside the US-ASCII range. The character encoding of the file needs to be declared in the transfer protocol or file needs to use a byte order mark as an encoding signature.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing a non-ascii attachment prints incorrect data due to lack of correct encoding

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having multiple indexers with the same id registered via multiple custom fields might cause the issue with reindexing due to {{CustomFieldIndexerAdapter}} doesn't delegate correctly.

Context: 
* It uses equals() and hashCode() from Object instead of delegating to the wrapped object which means that custom field indexers returned from com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.managers.FieldIndexerManagerImpl.getAllIssueIndexers() are no longer deduped.

h3. Expected Results
{{CustomFieldIndexerAdapter}} delegates correctly

h3. Actual Results
{{CustomFieldIndexerAdapter}} doesn't delegate correctly

The below exception is thrown in the Jira file during reindexing:
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: DocValuesField "sr_num_atch" appears more than once in this document (only one value is allowed per field)
{noformat}


h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: CustomFieldIndexerAdapter does not delegate correctly wrapped object

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding 'Single Email Address' to the notification scheme (any event) stops 'Batching email notifications' for that specific event
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable ⚙️> System > Batching email notifications
 # Configure the _Browse Projects_ [Permission Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-project-permissions-776636362.html] of a project to _Group (Anyone, including non-registered and anonymous users)_.
 # Set one of the events (i.e. *Issue Created*) of the [Notification Scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html] of that same project to _Single Email Address_ and enter a valid one. Save the changes.
 # Create a new ticket
 # None of the email recipients (reporter, groups, watchers, etc.) receive the batched email
 # Only the Single Email Address gets an email with a non-batched notification template
 # Other events (like Issue updated) works as expected with batched template

h3. Expected Results

All the recipients should receive batched email notifications including the event where Single Email Address is added
h3. Actual Results

All the recipients are not receiving batched email notifications for the event where is added Single Email Address

Only the Single Email Address gets an email with a non-batched notification template
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding 'Single Email Address' to the notification scheme stops 'Batching email notifications' for that specific event

WARNING [AbstractGCModelLoaderImpl]: Failed to create GCModel from /Users/adrianstephen/jira/atlassian-jira-software-8.11.0-standalone/logs/atlassian-jira-gc-2020-08-10_19-39-32.log
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.tagtraum.perf.gcviewer.imp.DataReaderException
...
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Failed to recognize file format.
{code}
h3. Workaround

Reply from [https://github.com/chewiebug/GCViewer/issues/245]
{quote}GCViewer relies for performance and complexity reasons on the presence of the "tags" and "level" information in the java unified logs generated by JDK 11 VMs ([https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/158]). Your logs are missing both (this part of the configuration:
 -Xlog:gc*:file=/<path-to-file>:time,uptime:...).

The readme gives examples of configurations, which GCViewer at this time is able to process:

-Xlog:gc:file="path-to-file" (uses defaults)
 -Xlog:gc=info:file="path-to-file":tags,uptime,level (minimum configuration needed)
 -Xlog:gc*=trace:file="path-to-file":tags,time,uptime,level (maximum configuration supported, additional tags ok, but ignored; additional decorations will break parsing)
 If you just add "tags" and "level" to your configuration, GCViewer should be able to parse your log files.

Best regards,
 Jörg
{quote}
JIRA Specific workaround for Linux
 # Stop Jira
 # Edit the JIRA_INSTALL/bin/set-gc-params.sh file
 # Modify this line :
{code:java}
 GC_JVM_PARAMETERS="-Xlog:gc*:file=$LOGBASEABS/logs/atlassian-jira-gc-%t.log:time,uptime:filecount=5,filesize=20M ${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS}"
{code}
to
{code:java}
 GC_JVM_PARAMETERS="-Xlog:gc*:file=$LOGBASEABS/logs/atlassian-jira-gc-%t.log:tags,time,uptime,level:filecount=5,filesize=20M ${GC_JVM_PARAMETERS}"
{code}
(i) Adding tags & level
 # Start Jira

JIRA Specific workaround for Windows
 # Stop Jira
 # Edit the JIRA_INSTALL/bin/set-gc-params.bat file
 # Modify this line :
{code:java}
 set GC_JVM_PARAMETERS=-Xlog:gc*:file=\"%atlassian_logsdir%\atlassian-jira-gc-%%t.log\":time,uptime:filecount=5,filesize=20M %GC_JVM_PARAMETERS%
{code}
to
{code:java}
 set GC_JVM_PARAMETERS=-Xlog:gc*:file=\"%atlassian_logsdir%\atlassian-jira-gc-%%t.log\":tags,time,uptime,level:filecount=5,filesize=20M %GC_JVM_PARAMETERS%
{code}
(i) Adding tags & level

 # Start Jira

JIRA Specific workaround for Windows when Jira is being run as a service
 * Stop service
 * Edit the JIRA_INSTALL/bin/set-gc-params-service.bat file
 * Modify this line :
{code:java}
set GC_JVM_PARAMETERS=%JVM_GC_ARGS%;-Xlog:gc*:file=.\logs\atlassian-jira-gc-%%t.log:time,uptime:filecount=5,filesize=20M
{code}
to
{code:java}
set GC_JVM_PARAMETERS=%JVM_GC_ARGS%;-Xlog:gc*:file=.\logs\atlassian-jira-gc-%%t.log:tags,time,uptime,level:filecount=5,filesize=20M
{code}
(i) Adding tags & level

 * *Reinstall service*
 * Start service
fields.summary: Java 11 GC logging configuration is not parseable in GCViewer

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Further improve custom field full reindex times and performance.
h3. Solution

Batch API was introduced to fetch custom field values for a batch of issues instead of one which should improve performance during full reindex operation.

 

 

(i) This feature is only available in Jira Data Center 8.12 and later.
fields.summary: Implement batch API for custom fields reindexing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When spinning up Jira for the first time utilizing the "quick start" templates in Azure the collation is set to English_United States:1252 this causes Jira to failed the startup collation test erroneously. This is the correct collation for Windows Postgres servers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Spin up a new Jira DC instance in the Azure portal using these [instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/running-jira-on-an-azure-cluster-969535564.html]
 # Attempt to start JIRA

h3. Expected Results
Jira health check does not give the false warning when using .1252 collations

h3. Actual Results
The collation check fails on startup
 !image.png|thumbnail!
 This is a false warning and can be ignored, provided the client encoding is set correctly.

h3. Suggested Solution
We should update the health check to accept the Windows equivalent of UTF-8.

h3. Notes
According to [Postgres|https://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.3/static/multibyte.html]:
{quote}UTF-8 encoding can be used with any locale.
{quote}
In addition, we've reviewed this [blog post|http://www.g-loaded.eu/2011/02/27/locale-windows/], Locale in Windows, and it appears that you should be able to use English_United States.1252.

h3. Workaround
You can click ignore and continue for now, until the health check is fixed.
fields.summary: collation error at startup when using Postgresql in Azure templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some plugins updates can not be downgraded, for instance, when the plugin has internal data structure changes.
We would like to have a clear advertisement that this may happen and general steps for a rollback.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Following our documentation at [Preparing for the upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/preparing-for-the-upgrade-966063325.html#Preparingfortheupgrade-apps]
 # One of the steps is to check "Check the compatibility of apps (add-ons)"

h3. Expected Results
* We would like to be advised to verify the downgrade steps at the plugin documentation prior do the plugin upgrade.
* The plugin could have a clear flag on the list of plugin versions on UPM that says "we know that upgrading to this version means you won't be able to downgrade". 

h3. Actual Results
We are not advised that this might happen. 
The steps provided on [Downgrading an Add-on to an Earlier Version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/downgrading-an-add-on-to-an-earlier-version-311918719.html] will not work as there were DB changes. 
The Database needs also to be restored.


h3. Workaround
1. Get the XML backup and backup jira-home/shared-home (cluster).
2. Stop Jira.
3. Restore Jira home/shared home from backup (this will restore the plugin/installed-plugin)
4. Start Jira.
5. Restore the XML backup
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, we would like to be alerted that a plugin may not be downgraded after upgrade

fields.description:
We would like to get some structure in our Jira project which means that we don't allow to link any issue type with any other issue type.

When using the standart IssueLinks it always allows to link to any other Jira issue, e.g. it can result in having a BusinessEpic as child of a Story or such nonsense.

Example:

We have BusinessEpic, Epic and Story as issue types in our project and want to configure that the Epic child-of link will only allow to enter the BusinessEpic issue types - it shall be filtered when the user tries to create the link.
fields.summary: Standard IssueLinks shall show only specific issue types to link to

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a node recovers an index from a snapshot it does not return {{503 Maintenance}} as it does when you do a full reindex, instead it returns a 200 and it still allows user traffic. 

This means that users can access a node without a working index, which results in incidents.

Jira should block access to a node that does not have a working index.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform and index recovery on a node
# Confirm you can still access that node while recovery is underway

h3. Expected Results
A node should block while it does not have a working index, the same as it does it you perform a full reindex.

h3. Actual Results
The node is available and users can access it, but without an index they cannot view issues, reports, etc.

h3. Workaround
# Manually remove the node from your load balancer while it is recovering the index
# Watch the logs for progress
# Once complete, manually re-add the node into the load balancer

NB: This affects all versions of Jira
fields.summary: When a node is recovering an index from snapshot it does not return 503

fields.description:
The activity feed today shows events updates in the following format:

05/Aug/20 11:01 AM

The preferred time stamp should include seconds like below:

05/Aug/20 11:01:22 AM

Reason: We need this functionality because we have sometimes MANY updates occurring within a minute time period like automation rules and other external integrations that are updating tickets. These updates can overlap along with real users making changes to tickets. To best determine when things happen within that minute interval we need seconds to be displayed.
fields.summary: Activity Feed Needs to show timestamps to include seconds

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Cache replication logging (_LocalQCacheManager_/_LocalQCacheReplicator_) is currently output to the *atlassian-jira.log*. This is undesirable as cache statistics messages are generated every minute, for every node, which overwhelms the logs, particularly when you're looking for non-cache-related events.

A similar situation maintains for index stats logging (snapshot stats, lucene-stats).

h3. Suggested Solution
Separating cache replication and index stats logging to dedicated log (e.g., *atlassian-jira-stats.log*) would greatly reduce the noise in atlassian-jira.log. Additionally, this will allow for retaining more cache stats and indexing stats logging, which is useful for examining trends over a large time frame.
fields.summary: Relocate cache replication and indexing stats to their own log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira cannot differentiate when the two attachments with the same name are inserted in two separate comments using the browse option in WYSIWYG editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create sample JSW project
Create a JSW issue
update the issue comment with image B (image.png)
update a new comment with image C (image.png)

h3. Expected Results

Jira should be able to differentiate between two different attachments with same name when they are added in different comments

h3. Actual Results
Jira is unable differentiate between the attachments.
When the attachment is an image and another image with the same name is attached, the previous comments with inline image/attachments will be pointed to the latest updated image (including the thumbnails)

h3. Workaround

After adding the attachment in the comment and then saving it.You need to update the reference of the attachment in the comment.
fields.summary: Jira cannot differentiate when the two attachments with the same name are inserted in two separate comments.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According to the Supported platforms document, Jira Server 8.5 only support AdoptOpenJDK up to version 11.0.2.
 - [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/supported-platforms-981154553.html]
{quote} - We support AdoptOpenJDK up to version 11.0.2.{quote}

However, JDK 11.0.2 caused below bug.
 - JRASERVER-70780: Webhooks intermittently stop working with Java 11

This bug fixed JDK 11.0.8 or JDK 13.
 - [https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8241054]
 - [https://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk/jdk13/rev/5022a4915fe9]

h3. Suggestion
Since Jira Software 8.5 is long term support release, that would be nice to support up to 11.0.8.
 - [Long Term Support releases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/long-term-support-releases-948227420.html]
fields.summary: Ability to support other version of AdoptOpenJDK in 8.5.x

fields.description:
-Similar to [JRASERVER-63438|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63438]-
h1. Problem

The 'Share with Customer' button in the form to enter a comment has a keyboard shortcut for submitting the form, which on Mac+Chrome is *Ctrl+Alt+e*. With the new Visual mode editor for comments, the keyboard shortcut does nothing.

Note: -Tested on Mac using Chrome.-
 Customer's Note: -This key combination does not work in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or Edge for Mac, and we have also found it not to work in Chrome for Windows (not sure about others).-
h1. Steps to reproduce
 # Create/view an issue, press the Comment button
 # Enter a comment and use the keyboard shortcut to submit the form while having the Visual tab selected.

h2. Expected

A comment is added as a result of step one and another comment is added as a result of step 2.
h2. Actual

Only using the Comment button works. The shortcut does not seem to work at all (neither Alt+e for Internal comment nor Alt+s for regular comment in SD projects)
h4. Some other tests made to check:

*Visual Mode*
 * CTRL+ALT+E (x)
 * COMMAND+ALT+E (x)
 * CTRL+ALT+S (/) 
 *Text Mode*
 * CTRL+ALT+E (x)
 * CTRL+ALT+S (/)

Notes: The above 'Visual' and 'Text' mode results were tested with Jira Software 8.5.4 and 8.11.0. The customer who noticed this problem could use Ctrl-Alt-e if he switches to "text" mode instead of "Visual".
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for submitting a comment does not work correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

According to our [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] page, at the moment, we only support Jira running on x86 hardware and 64-bit derivatives of x86 hardware.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a Jira distribution that officially supports ARM processors in newer Jira versions.
fields.summary: Add support to ARM architecture processors

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the subject of email id is UTF encoded then while parsing such email, the handler creates a new ticket for every response instead of adding a comment. This is because while parsing emails the normal space before and after the ticket gets dropped 

 No space before and after issue key in the subject creates a new ticket for every response
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # I sent an email to my mailbox and it first created a new ticket
 # Copied the issue key from the new ticket created notification which is "AT-15"
 # Sent another email to the mail server with subject as "3A=C2=A0 AT-15 _Aw=3A=C .
 # Here, in this case, Mail handler reads the subject line and recognize the issue-key and add the comment to the original ticket 
 # I sent another email to the mail server with subject as "3A=C2=A0AT-15_Aw=3A=C .
 # Here, in this case, Mail handler is unable to read the subject line for issue key hence created a new ticket 
 # This is because in the first case we added a space before and after the issue key hence mail handler could read the issue key but in the second case since there is no space added hence Mail handler is unable to read the subject line for issue key 

h3. Expected Results

It should add a comment to the ticket but instead, it created a new ticket 
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
It created a new ticket {noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround available 

h3. Note

This issue impacts both:
- the Jira Mail Handler configured in *⚙> System > Incoming Mails*
- the Service Desk Mail Handler configured in *Project Settings > Email Requests*
fields.summary: Handler create s new ticket for every response when there is no space before and after the issue key

fields.description:
In Kanban Boards it is only possible to create predefined quick filters. 

In Backlog when using Scrum there is a search bar where the user can type a text search. 

This functionality would be great for Kanban boards.
fields.summary: Add search bar to Kanban Boards as it is in Backlog when using Scrum

fields.description: As a user I need to query the status from JIRA as it was on a specific date. This comes in handy for instance when preparing reports and meeting notes that require a snapshot of a search in JIRA without having to work this around by taking a screenshot and pasting it as an image.
fields.summary: JQL query "as of" a specific date

fields.description:
As a requirement for our enterprise environment, we are required to implement monitoring of privileged user accounts and implement a system to alert when suspicious activity occurs.

We'd like this feature to be implemented in Jira, perhaps, as part of the Jira audit logging
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to monitor privileged user activity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Radio Button custom field options are not showing when accessing Jira via Internet Explorer 11. This issue only seems to occur when embedded search JQL is in the URL. Such as:
http://example.domain.com:8080/browse/TEST-123?jql=project%20%3D%20TEST

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Radio Button custom field and add it to relevant screens.
# Go to the Issue Navigator and switch to the list view of issues.
# When accessing any issues from the list, note that the JQL parameter is still on the URL (expected behavior).
# Try to edit the value of the field (either in-line or via the screen) and see that the radio buttons are not selectable.

(i) The issue is reproducible on _Internet Explorer only_, which is no longer supported as of 8.6.x.

h3. Expected Results
The field values are selectable and the user is able to edit it.

h3. Actual Results
The radio buttons do not show up. There are no exceptions on the browser console nor on a HAR file.

h3. Workaround
Remove the JQL parameters on the URL and reload the page.
fields.summary: Radio Buttons do not render when accessing Jira via IE11

fields.description:
We have several tabs containing various fields for an issue type creation screen.  If we set some of the fields to required on different tabs, the user has no visual indication which tabs contain required fields and must search though all the forms to find which required field is preventing submission.  
Please add some visual indication, like an asterisk or red text, to show if a tab contains required fields which prevent users from submitting changes.
fields.summary: Mark tabs which contain required fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The use of racially charged terms like "whitelist" and "blacklist" connotate goodness and badness to specific colors, which can be exclusionary and offensive.

h3. Solution

Use non-exclusionary terms instead.

h3. Notes

The change has been made in our documentation but not in-product. For example, [Configuring the allowlist|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-allowlist-1014667309.html].
fields.summary: Consider renaming "Whitelist" and "Blacklist" to "Allowlist" and "Blocklist"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Frequent warnings are being logged when *DefaultIssueIndexer* is provided with an empty list of issues to reindex.

DevStatus plugin calls DefaultIssueIndexer when there are no issues to replicate, causing a high number or WARN messages.
 This extra logging started after the upgrade to Jira 8.10.0 from Jira 7.6.6.

The messages are triggered under two different conditions:

 

*1) From DevStatus ServiceRunner:*
{code:java}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there are huge number of groups (more than 1500) added to the "Application access" permission, the page *Application Access* becomes unresponsive
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Pre-requisite:* There should be more than 1500 groups in the Jira instance
 # Add  1500 groups to the "Jira Software" Application Access
 # Click on *Cog Icon* > Applications > Application Access
 # The page will keep on loading and will give multiple errors (Attached herewith)

There are no traces of error in the logs related to the behavior

Heap size : 2GB
h3. Expected Results

The page should load without any errors
h3. Actual Results

The page never loads due to which new projects cannot be configured and application access can't be granted
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Application access page not accessible if the number of groups exceeds 1500

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In certain situations, when *Created vs Resolved Chart* gadget is included in narrower dashboard layouts or monitor/browser sizes are reduced, data points for last week "Created Issues" show the week before rather than the present week.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Created vs Resolved Chart* in Jira Dashboard, with the following configuration:
 ** Saved filter containing multiple issues (both created and resolved in the past few months).
 ** Period: weekly.
 ** Days Previously: 300.
 ** Collection Operation: Cumulative.
 ** Display the Trend of Unresolved: Yes.
 ** Display Versions: None.
 ** Auto Refresh box: Checked.

 # Change dashboard layout to either a 3 columns or a 50% and narrower layout column layouts.
 ** This behavior is also experienced when using the full-width layout, both when changing the scale of the monitor screen to a smaller one or when the browser window is not maximized.

h3. Expected Results
 * Users should be able to see present week data when hovering the mouse over the last data points for *Created Issues*.

h3. Actual Results
 * Instead, users see the week before data for *Created Issues*.
 ** Attached screenshot shows a test conducted on the week of 25th July.
 ** When clicking in the last data point, dates and issue counts are correct. It's only when hovering the mouse over where the behavior appears.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Changing dashboard layout truncates recent week's data in Created vs. Resolved gadget

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting the indexing language to German, the JQL search does not work as expected.

For example, If there is an issue with the summary "Test DA".

The JQL Query "summary ~ Test" will return the issue.
 The JQL Query "summary ~ DA" will not return the issue ( occurs intermittently )
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue with the summary as "TEST DA"
 # Change the Indexing language & Default language to German
 # Reindex the JIRA
 # Try to search the issue using "summary ~ DA" using the advance JQL search.

h3. Expected Results

It should return the issue where the summary has the word DA
h3. Actual Results

It intermittently returns results. Please refer to this video recording :
 [^2020-08-04_15-49-05.mp4]

From the logs we also see the same :
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

We can currently use the escape sequence as given here :
{code:java}
summary ~ \"DA\"{code}
Or continue to click the Search button until the results appear.
fields.summary: JQL search broken when indexing language is set to German

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Applying a workflow on a sub-task issue type having a condition that shouldn't allow the transition if a crucible review associated is open fails, and allows the transition to happen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue type of sub-task type "*Modify Individual Module*" and associate this with one of the projects.
 # Create a workflow with 2 statuses "*Source Code Peer Review*" and "*DV Peer Review Passed*" and add a transition "*Approve Source Code Changes*", which takes the issue from  the ticket in state "*Source Code Peer Review*" to "*DV Peer Review Passed"*. Add a condition to workflow "This transition will only execute if there are no *Open* Crucible reviews related to this issue." (The naming conventions can be base on user choice).
 # Update the workflow scheme used by this project to use this workflow for this issue type "Modify Individual Module" and one of the standard issue type (say bug).
 # Link both Jira 8.5.4 and FECR 4.8.0 through application links.
 # Create a Jira issue of "*Bug*" type and a sub-task of "*Modify Individual Module*".
 # Create a Crucible review and add both the issues to linked issues in Crucible review and ensure that 1 open review is highlighted in both Jira issues.
 # Now execute the transitions for issue type "*Modify Individual Module*" and see it complete successfully without checking any conditions.
 # Try the same steps for issue type "*Bug*" and see the condition is applied and transition option will not appear as long as the Crucible review is in open state.

h3. Expected Results
- As we can associate same workflows to standard and sub-task issue types, both should respect the condition "This transition will only execute if there are no *Open* Crucible reviews related to this issue" evaluation before the transition.
- If this not applicable for sub-task issue types, it should be clearly documented and needs to be added as a current limitation to the the feature.

h3. Actual Results
- The sub-task issue types wont respect the workflow condition "This transition will only execute if there are no *Open* Crucible reviews related to this issue" and allow the transitions to happen smoothly.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Applying a workflow on a sub-task issue type having a condition "This transition will only execute if there are no Open Crucible reviews related to this issue" fails and allows transitions to happen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After an upgrade Jira updates the Upgrade Report page:
 <base-url>/secure/PostUpgradeLandingPage.jspa

If there is any non-Atlassian application link, this page will point out an application link error:
 !image-2020-07-31-17-59-51-991.png|width=399,height=208!

There is no actual connection error or failure in the Application Link health check. This seems to be a false positive as this page cannot account for the status of non-Atlassian application links.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up any non-Atlassian application link
 # [Upgrade Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/upgrading-jira-installer-938846937.html]
 # Go to Administration - Latest upgrade Report
 # Click on Application links failing: 1 > Show Details
 # Test all Applications links to make sure they're working by navigating through the links
 # If all links are working and the Upgrade report error persists - Remove the Non-Atlassian application link as a test (Make sure to take note of all credentials and link before deleting)
 # Go to Administration - Latest upgrade Report again
 # The error should be cleared out
 # Add the Non-Atlassian application link back

h3. Expected Results

If all applications links are healthy, do not show an error
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown even though all application links are connected
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira upgrade landing page will throw an Application Link error if there is a non Atlassian Application Link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue has been noted with *ORA-00955* error in other places, but the other bugs mention Greenhopper (Software suite) specifically.  This failure is on an app table. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take an XML backup from a site with Zephyr installed. 
 # Import the XML backup into a site with Oracle 12c database.  

The driver does not seem to matter (version 12 vs. version 19).  
h3. Expected Results

XML import completes without error. 

_IF it did encounter an error_, then we also expect that dropping the table or sequence would fix it (it does not help). 
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-25 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: 
There was an error during import/export with plugin Zephyr for JIRA(com.thed.zephyr.je) #5.4.1.54108287 (table AO_7DEABF_CUSTOM_FIELD_PROJECT):Error executing update for SQL statement 'CREATE SEQUENCE "AO_7DEABF_CUSTOM_FI302672883" INCREMENT BY 1 START WITH 1 NOMAXVALUE MINVALUE 1'
...
Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-00955: name is already used by an existing object
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

_Deleting the sequence, table, or database does not help as listed in previous bugs._ 

Instead, you must modify the XML backup, specifically the activeobjects.xml:

The solution is to change the autoIncrement="true"to "false" in a single line of activeobjects.xml, for table name="AO_7DEABF_CUSTOM_FIELD"
 * Original line in your system:
{noformat}
<column name="PROJECT_ID" primaryKey="false" autoIncrement="true" sqlType="2" precision="20"/>
{noformat}

 * Changed line (solution)
{noformat}
<column name="PROJECT_ID" primaryKey="false" autoIncrement="false" sqlType="2" precision="20"/>{noformat}

Here are the steps needed for changing the file:
 # Unzip the backup.zip file in a specific folder
 # Edit the referred line into the table <table name="AO_7DEABF_CUSTOM_FIELD">
 # Save the file
 # Add the 2 files in a new zip file
 # Copy this file to the recover location and proceed with the restore using Jira admin interface.

It is important that only the 2 files must be zipped, if you put only them in a folder and zip the folder, this will not work.
fields.summary: Importing XML backup in Jira 8 with Oracle 12 database fails with ORA-00955: Name is Already Used by an Existing Object

h2. Issue

When we ask another user to authorize Jira when trying to connect Github with Jira, the user still needs to have admin permission in order to authorize. currently, https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0713/linking-a-bitbucket-or-github-repository-with-jira-964983144.html doesn't clearly state that the user still needs to have admin permission if we use a different use to authorize Jira. 

h2. Summary

Please add the following to https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0713/linking-a-bitbucket-or-github-repository-with-jira-964983144.html. 
{quote}
The user used to authorize Jira needs to have admin permission in order to authorize the connection between Jira and Github. 
{quote}

fields.description:
According to this documentation

https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver085/set-up-a-jira-data-center-cluster-993929512.html

Under the section *_2. Set up the shared directory_*
{code}
You'll need to create a remote directory that is readable and writable by all nodes in the cluster. There are multiple ways to do this, but the simplest is to use an NFS share.

Create a remote directory, accessible by all nodes in the cluster, and name it e.g. sharedhome. 
Stop your Jira instance.
Copy the following directories from the Jira local home directory to the new sharedhome directory (some of them may be empty).

data
plugins
logos
import
export
caches
{code}


However, few directories are no more required in local JIRA HOME , specially the DATA directory which is known to occupy HUGE space and it will be redundant disc utilisation in both JIRA shard home and JIRA local home, so ideally these directories should be moved instead of copy.

We understand that it's a risk to move DATA directory initially, because if there is a failure of this move operation due to some OS related errors, the data might get lost. 

h3. Suggestion Recommended. 
Take a backup of this data directory to a different mount point. And then try the move operation. If the move operation is successful (do a chksum on both backup directory and the moved directory) then we can get rid of the backup directory.
fields.summary: [Documentation] Suggest to Update the document when moving from one node data center to Cluster nodes Data center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading to Jira Data Center 8.10.x and version 4.1.0 of [SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216096/sso-for-atlassian-server-and-data-center?hosting=datacenter&tab=versions], users cannot log in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(!) This is based on information from the customer, Jira team was not able to reproduce it
 # Have a Jira Data Center 8.9.0 instance with SSO for Jira Data Center 4.0.2.
 # Upgrade Jira Data Center to 8.10.0
 # Upgrade SSO for Jira Data Center to supported version 4.1.0, which adds support for Just In Time user provisioning

*Note:* JIT user provisioning is not configured before or after the upgrade.
h3. Expected Results

The upgraded plugin operates as normal, users can log in.
h3. Actual Results

Users cannot log in.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log:
{code:java}
2020-07-20 15:53:01,400+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-117 ERROR anonymous 953x39481x1 xxxxxxx .xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx,xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx,xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx /plugins/servlet/oidc/callback [c.a.p.a.i.web.filter.ErrorHandlingFilter] Received SSO request for user preferred_username, but the user does not exist
com.atlassian.plugins.authentication.impl.web.usercontext.AuthenticationFailedException: Received SSO request for user preferred_username, but the user does not exist
{code}
h3. Workaround

Revert to an earlier version of SSO for Jira Data Center. Version 4.0.2 has been known to work as expected and can be downloaded from the [app versions page.|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216096/sso-for-atlassian-server-and-data-center/version-history]
fields.summary: "Received SSO request for user preferred_username, but the user does not exist" after upgrade to Jira Data Center 8.10 with SSO plugin 4.1.0

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently there's no built-in feature to disable @mention notifications for a specific project.
h3. Suggested Solution

As an admin, I should be able to disable/enable the @mention email notifications for any project.
h3. Why this is important

This functionality could help to prevent sensitive information to be exposed when the @mention feature is being used.
h3. Workaround

There are two things that allow @mention to work.
 * The @mention uses the *Browse Users* global permission to determine whether they will be able to see the user list or not. So to prevent this you can remove all groups in the Browse Users global permission so your user would not be able to search for the user at all. The downside of doing this is you would not be able to search for the user even in any other field such as Assignee or Reporter. For more details please see [Managing global permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-global-permissions-776636359.html].

 * The comment field needs to be of *Wiki Style Renderer*. By default; fields like *Description* or *Comment* is set to Wiki Style Renderer. If you change it to Default Text Renderer in your Field Configuration; you will no longer be able to use @mention. However, you'd also not be able to styling your text in the Comment any more and you can't no longer use tags such as the code tag. For instructions please refer to [Specifying field behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/specifying-field-behavior-776636443.html].

{panel}
Note:
 (!) You can avoid @ mention notifications to be sent, using the deviation caused by JRASERVER-61622 - JIRA is not sending the Mention notification when using quotes:
{quote} # Configure an Outgoing Mail in JIRA
 # Create a new project;
 # Edit the Project's Notification Email to have quotes on it{quote}{panel}
fields.summary: Ability to disable the @mention notifications for a specific project

h3. Summary

Currently CSV import only alow to use Second format to import estimate field.
 - [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html#ImportingdatafromCSV-TipsforimportingCSVdataintoJirafields]
{quote}
|Original Estimate|The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds.|
|Remaining Estimate|The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds.|
|Time Spent|The value of this field needs to be specified as number of seconds.|
{quote}

h3. Expected

Accept below format as well. e.g. 1w2d3h4m
 - [Logging work on issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/logging-work-on-issues-939937923.html]
{quote} - You can specify additional time units after a time value 'X', such as Xw, Xd, Xh, or Xm, to represent weeks (w), days (d), hours (h), and minutes (m), respectively. If you type a number without specifying a time unit (e.g. if you type '2' instead of '2h'), the default time unit that your Jira administrator specified will apply.
 - Default conversion rates are 1w = 5d and 1d = 8h.{quote}

Some users need to have external links in Description / Comments to open in new browser window.
Looks like this should be per-user configurable.

*Workaround*
Use the middle-click on your mouse if you have a three-button mouse, ctrl-click on Windows/Unix, or cmd-click on Mac.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This may or may not be isolated to webhooks usage.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect MS Teams to Jira. 

h3. Expected Results

The connection stays active and does not spawn new thread.  
h3. Actual Results

Teams shows disconnected.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2020-07-23 15:08:14,700+0000 Timer-32 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.microsoft.signalr.HubConnection] HubConnection disconnected with an error: Server timeout elapsed without receiving a message from the server..
2020-07-23 15:08:14,700+0000 Timer-12 ERROR      [c.microsoft.signalr.HubConnection] HubConnection disconnected with an error: Server timeout elapsed without receiving a message from the server..
{noformat}
 You may also see 
{code:java}
ServiceRunner     [c.m.teams.service.SignalRService] startConnectionIfDisconnected() error (java.lang.RuntimeException): Unexpected status code returned from negotiate: 503 Service Unavailable. {code}
A "Client error - 400 when posting webhook" may also be logged. 

Thread dumps contain thousands of threads with the same stack trace:
{code:java}
pool-1551-thread-1
priority:5 - threadId:0x0000000000001a41 - nativeId:0 - nativeId (decimal):0 - state:WAITING
stackTrace:
java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
at java.base@11.0.6/jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
- parking to wait for <0x000000002a1d3451> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:194)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2081)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1170)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:899)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1054)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1114)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Locked ownable synchronizers:
- None
{code}
{code:java}
OkHttp WebSocket https://msteams-jira-server.service.signalr.net/...
priority:5 - threadId:0x0000000000001784 - nativeId:0 - nativeId (decimal):0 - state:WAITING
stackTrace:
java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
at java.base@11.0.6/jdk.internal.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
- parking to wait for <0x0000000031ea767a> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:194)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2081)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:1170)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$DelayedWorkQueue.take(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:899)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.getTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1054)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1114)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
at java.base@11.0.6/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Locked ownable synchronizers:
- None
{code}
You may also see thousands of open files.

_This may also be related to Out Of Memory errors as described in [Jira server throws OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-server-throws-outofmemoryerror-unable-to-create-new-native-thread-224397455.html]._  
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

As a short time solution, the only remedy is to remove the Teams integration completely to avoid major problems. 
PS: Simply disabling the app will not resolve this.  

h3. Note on fix
Please update ["Microsoft Teams for Jira Server"|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217836/microsoft-teams-for-jira?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]  to the *2021.07.57* version to get the fix.
fields.summary: Using MS Teams in Jira spawns incrementing unclosed threads
